doc.previous: Newcastle Mela, held on the late August bank holiday weekend, is an annual two-day multicultural event, blending drama, music and food from Punjabi, Pakistani, Bengali and Hindu cultures.[151] NewcastleGateshead also holds an annual International Arts Fair. The 2009 event will be in the Norman Foster designed Sage Gateshead Music and Arts Centre in September.[152] In October, there is the Design Event festivalâan annual festival providing the public with an opportunity to see work by regional, national and international designers.[153] The SAMA Festival, an East Asian cultural festival is also held in early October.[154]
doc.after: The 1960s saw the internationally successful rock group The Animals, emerge from Newcastle night spots such as Club A-Go-Go[155] on Percy Street. Other well-known acts with connections to the city include Sting,[156] Bryan Ferry,[157] Dire Straits[158] and more recently MaxÃ¯mo Park.[159]
